subject: Critical Thinking
title: Digital Citizenship: Sharing Responsibly in a Connected World
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Digital Citizenship: Sharing Responsibly in a Connected World.

hook.text: You share a false story. Your 500 friends share it. Each of their friends shares it.

buildup.text: Every share is an implicit endorsement.

discovery.text: Digital citizenship: using technology responsibly, ethically, and with awareness of its impact on others and society.

twist.text: The most effective misinformation fighters aren't fact-checkers â€” they're ordinary people who pause before sharing.

climax.text: Before sharing: Is it true? Is the source credible? Is it helpful? Could it cause harm? If unsure, don't share.

punchline.text: The share button is a broadcast tool. Use it like one.

quiz.question: What is the most effective way ordinary people can combat misinformation?
options: Pausing to verify claims before sharing them
